alert.note: Alert for Summit (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 12:03AM EDT until June 14 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN STARK...SOUTH CENTRAL SUMMIT...WAYNE AND HOLMES COUNTIES... At 1202 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Rittman to near Wooster to near Nashville, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Canton, Wooster, Millersburg, Massillon, Green, North Canton, Orrville, Berlin, Rittman, Walnut Creek, Doylestown, Loudonville, Creston, Brewster, Navarre, Dalton, Shreve, Waynesburg, East Sparta and Killbuck. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
